intro: Onosma waltonii, commonly known as the Walton's sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. Onosma waltonii is a member of the Boraginaceae family, known for its medicinal and ornamental value in certain regions.
